name: Scandic Continental

reviews.text: I stayed 2 nights on a business trip at the Scandic Contitental hotel in Stockholm. What I liked about the hotel most: location. the metro station just under the hotel made it very easy to commute. Main attractions, such as shopping areas and the old town were also within walking distance.
reviews.title: Scandic Continental: good average

likes.liked: — Ask for the free WLAN connection from the reception!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the other hand the hotel was located on a very busy street, so the traffic noise was quite loud in the night as well. The central station seemed to attract some drunken people, even if on monday and tuesday, so one night I woke up in the night as people were shouting and singing on the street!
reviews.title: Rundown - More a Motel than a Hotel

reviews.text: The room was big enough for 1 person, and very clean, but maybe a little old fashioned. I had to struggle for a while to get the shower working... Breakfast was nothing special.
reviews.title: Fine, but I prefer the Scandic Anglais

reviews.text: All in all, I might stay at this hotel another time. The stay was totally ok.
reviews.title: Great stay
Great Stay at the Scandic
reviews.text: The lobby and restaurant areas look great and modern, but the room itself was really run down and shabby. I was shocked because it was definitely more the condition one would see with a low quality motel than what is supposed to be a nice hotel. It was reasonably clean, although there were scuffs and stains throughout the room. There was also a wall-mounted mini-fridge right above a bench near the entrance. One of us sat on the bench to put on shoes and stood up, smacking our head on the sharp corner of the mini fridge. This seemed like an unnecessary hazard (to place a bench for sitting on underneath a wall mounted fridge with sharp corners) and poor design.

The hotel is situated just next to the central station in the financial area. A 10 min. walk will take you to the old city. The staff was very helpful, but we found the room was falling apart. The bathroom has several faults and the mini bar couldn't cool. (Was even unplugged when we arrived...)
reviews.title: Good value and location, but room needed to be restored...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The big plus was the very child-friendly atmosphere, as a play area was placed in the lobby and a big separate room showed children's movies at breakfast allowing mummy and daddy to have a nice long breakfast.
reviews.title: Bad experience in good lockation From Norway

reviews.text: This was a bad experience. I got good offer on net page but went to the hotel web page to check out picture and price there. we went for the superior room and was suprized when we only got a small room that locked like the standard room, This is just a budget hotel with simple rom, average breakfast and bad service. the lobby bar and everything else was closed during the stay.
reviews.title: Average business hotel; could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The major advantage of this hotel is its location, directly opposite the Central train station where the Arlanda Express terminates, and next to a T-Centralen metro entrance. This is a typical large Scandinavian business hotel with reasonably-sized rooms. Rooms are reaonably quiet but with some traffic noise from neighbouring busy streets penetrating the double-glased windows (and a good deal more if the ventilator is opened). The decor is curiously old-fashioned by Swedish standards, including the bathrooms which have old-American-style showers in bathtubs, which could be difficult to access for older visitors. The free internet access is excellent, as is the generous buffet breakfast which includes a great variety of exotic Swedish cereals but stranegly few international favourites.
reviews.title: Good location, delicious breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a very nice weekend there. The location is excellent; the rooms are confortable, very clean and good size; the staff was helpful and the breakfast was incredible. I had never seen so much (good) food in a breakfast! The only problem is the big mess during breakfast. The breakfast area is big, but not big enough when the hotel is full. This was the case when we stayed there and it was hard to get a table on both days. Anyway, we would stay there again for sure.
reviews.title: Great location!!

reviews.text: We (me, my husband, my 2 year old daughter) stayed at this hotel for two nights and had chosen the place because it was said to be a family friendly hotel.
reviews.title: Not family friendly

likes.liked: — Location and easy access to main train station
likes.disliked: — arrogant staff, no friendliness, stale, old rooms

reviews.text: We were given a two-bed room at the 3rd floor that smelled stale and looked like something that might have been pretty in the early nineties. The furniture was scratched and the door of the bathroom was dented and scratched in several places. The beds were/looked clean but had a used, sour-sweetish smell that reminded me of the smell in old gymnasiums (many peoples' sweat, not efficient cleaning). There was a clean and ok crib for the child.
reviews.title: A room so small you'd have to leave to change your mind

likes.liked: — Amazing location, good value in an expensive city, comfy beds, shower water pressure, free wifi, use of mirrors to make small space more roomy
likes.disliked: — Room was really tiny, no closet, poor fitness center, tired decor in public areas, wall mounted soap and shampoo, no windows or views in room, twin bed.

reviews.text: Soon after our arrival we went downstairs to try out the children's play-room. On asking at reception, the lady just pointed into the direction of the room and said "There!". Then she went on with whatever she had to do. In a general sense I got the impression that customers are treated differently as the gentlemen before me (on a business-trip) was treated with all the friendliness you would expect.
reviews.title: So-so

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The children-room was a Five (!!) square meter windowless "cell" with some plastic children-chairs plus a couple of books (in Swedish) and a handfull of building blocks. A blackboard on one side of the room could not be used and was dirty.
reviews.title: Efficient service and central location but no charm

reviews.text: The staff is arrogant if you have a question about sights of the city and how to get there.
reviews.title: Great location, don't look for charm in this hotel

reviews.text: I was meeting two friends in Stockholm for the night. We booked a three person room via Expedia. Luckily we had the booking confirmation when we arrived as they had no record that we had booked and paid for a three person room and only had a standard two person room reserved for us. A freshly made-up fold-out bed was promptly brought to the room with towels. I slept on the fold-out which was surprisingly comfortable.
reviews.title: It was OK

likes.liked: — Breakfast, service and my surprisingly comfortable fold away bed
likes.disliked: — bathroom basin was not nice and room decor tired

reviews.text: The weather was overcast and quite chilly during the stop-over. The room was tired in decor but was clean and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was small and adequate but really not that nice. The view was nothing to write about.
reviews.title: Stay here for the location...

reviews.text: On the evening we arrived we went out for a walk and finally ended up in the hotel bar where we drank Swedish beer and were well attended by the bar lady who was very nice. The breakfast was great with good coffee and a nice selection.
reviews.title: OK hotel, great location

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is central and opposite the central train terminal and not far from the central bus terminal which is the method of transport that I used to travel from the airport - half the price of the train and only 10 minutes longer.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: In summary the staff were great, the breakfast was good and rooms clean and bed comfy. Not sure I would rate the room I stayed in 3 star but the stars are for facilities mainly.
reviews.title: Loved my cabin!

likes.liked: — The service was great and the room was original.

description: Popular Multi-story Hotel situated in center of town, across street from train station & airport buses.
